description: This historic, attractive village is located in North Yorkshire near Lastingham, Pickering and Kirkbymoorside. Nestled in the heart of the North York Moors National Park, this picturesque settlement enjoys a stunning natural setting amidst rolling hills, heather-covered moorlands, and ancient woodlands. The village itself is a quintessential example of rural English life, with traditional stone-built houses and cottages that blend seamlessly with the natural beauty of the surroundings. Local highlights include a significant 19th century church and a fine pub dating to the 17th century. This walk from the village takes you to neighbouring Sinnington which lies just to the south of the settlement. On the way you can enjoy a lovely riverside footpath along the River Seven and take in some pleasant countryside views. Please scroll down for the full list of walks near and around Appleton Le Moors. The detailed maps below also show a range of footpaths, bridleways and cycle paths in the area.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Moors Inn is an historic pub dating to the 17th century. They serve good quality dishes and also have a lovely garden area with views of the countryside and hills. The pub was the Winner of York CAMRA country pub of the season in Spring 2011. You can find them at postcode YO62 6TF for your sat navs. They have a car park and are also dog friendly.

display_address: The Old Post Office, Kirkgate Lane, Hamley House, Appleton-le-Moors, North Yorkshire, York and North Yorkshire, England, YO62 6TE, United Kingdom
